task: Create a new instance of a class that represents a book, with properties for title, author, and ISBN number.
code:
```applescript
-- Define a Book class
script Book
    property title : ""
    property author : ""
    property isbn : ""
end script

-- Create a new instance of Book
set newBook to Book's alloc()'s init()
set newBook's title to "Sample Title"
set newBook's author to "Sample Author"
set newBook's isbn to "123-4567890123"
```

task: Instantiate an object of a class named Car, and set its make, model, and year attributes.

```applescript
    property make : ""
    property model : ""
    property year : ""
end script

```

task: Develop a class to represent a rectangle, then create an object with specific width and height.
code:
```applescript
-- Define a Rectangle class
script Rectangle
    property width : 0
    property height : 0
    
    on initialize(w, h)
        set width to w
        set height to h
    end initialize
end script

-- Create an instance of Rectangle with specific width and height
set myRectangle to Rectangle's script
tell myRectangle to initialize(100, 50)
```

task: Construct an object of a class Person, initializing it with a name and age.
code:
```applescript
-- Define the Person class
script Person
    property name : ""
    property age : 0
    
    on initWithNameAndAge(theName, theAge)
        set name to theName
        set age to theAge
        return me
    end initWithNameAndAge
end script

-- Create an object of the Person class
set personInstance to Person's initWithNameAndAge("John Doe", 30)
```

task: Create an object of a class named BankAccount, initializing it with an account number and balance.
code:
```applescript
property accountNumber : ""
property balance : 0

on createBankAccount(number, initialBalance)
    script BankAccount
        property accountNumber : number
        property balance : initialBalance
    end script
    return BankAccount
end createBankAccount

set myAccount to createBankAccount("123456789", 1000)
```

task: Write a class for a movie, then instantiate it with a title, director, and release year.
code:
```applescript
script Movie
    property title : ""
    property director : ""
    property releaseYear : ""

    on setTitle(newTitle)
        set title to newTitle
    end setTitle

    on setDirector(newDirector)
        set director to newDirector
    end setDirector

    on setReleaseYear(newYear)
        set releaseYear to newYear
    end setReleaseYear

    on getTitle()
        return title
    end getTitle

    on getDirector()
        return director
    end getDirector

    on getReleaseYear()
        return releaseYear
    end getReleaseYear
end script

set myMovie to Movie's script
myMovie's setTitle("Inception")
myMovie's setDirector("Christopher Nolan")
myMovie's setReleaseYear(2010)
```

task: Create an instance of a class called Computer with attributes for CPU, RAM, and storage.
code:
```applescript
-- Define the Computer class
script Computer
    property CPU : ""
    property RAM : ""
    property storage : ""

    -- Constructor method to initialize a new Computer instance
    on makeNewComputer(cpuType, ramSize, storageSize)
        set CPU to cpuType
        set RAM to ramSize
        set storage to storageSize
        return me
    end makeNewComputer
end script

-- Create an instance of the Computer class
set myComputer to Computer's makeNewComputer("Intel i7", "16GB", "512GB")
```

task: Instantiate an object of a class named House with attributes for address, number of bedrooms, and price.
code:
```applescript
property |address| : ""
property numberOfBedrooms : 0
property price : 0

on makeHouse(theAddress, theBedrooms, thePrice)
	script House
		property |address| : theAddress
		property numberOfBedrooms : theBedrooms
		property price : thePrice
	end script
	return House
end makeHouse

set myHouse to makeHouse("123 Apple Lane", 3, 250000)
```

task: Develop a class for a Ship with properties for name, capacity, and type, then instantiate it.
code:
```applescript
-- Define a class for a Ship
script Ship
    property name : ""
    property capacity : 0
    property shipType : ""

    on init(theName, theCapacity, theType)
        set name to theName
        set capacity to theCapacity
        set shipType to theType
    end init

    on description()
        return "Ship Name: " & name & ", Capacity: " & capacity & ", Type: " & shipType
    end description
end script

-- Instantiate a Ship object
set myShip to Ship's script
myShip's init("Black Pearl", 500, "Pirate Ship")

-- Access the description of the ship
set shipDescription to myShip's description()
display dialog shipDescription
```

task: Create a new object from a class named Dinosaur, initializing it with species and period.
code:
```applescript
property species : ""
property period : ""

script Dinosaur
    property parent : class "NSObject"
    property species : ""
    property period : ""
    
    on initWithSpeciesAndPeriod(theSpecies, thePeriod)
        set species to theSpecies
        set period to thePeriod
        return me
    end initWithSpeciesAndPeriod
end script

set myDinosaur to Dinosaur's initWithSpeciesAndPeriod("Tyrannosaurus Rex", "Cretaceous")
```

task: Write a class for a Tree with properties for species, height, and age, and instantiate it.
code:
```applescript
script Tree
    property species : ""
    property height : 0
    property age : 0

    on setSpecies(newSpecies)
        set species to newSpecies
    end setSpecies

    on setHeight(newHeight)
        set height to newHeight
    end setHeight

    on setAge(newAge)
        set age to newAge
    end setAge

    on getSpecies()
        return species
    end getSpecies

    on getHeight()
        return height
    end getHeight

    on getAge()
        return age
    end getAge
end script

set myTree to script Tree
tell myTree
    setSpecies("Oak")
    setHeight(15)
    setAge(50)
end tell
```
